plot: Distributed Reinforcement Learning for Robot Teams: A Review
summary: Recent advances in sensing, actuation, and computation have opened the door to multi-robot systems consisting of hundreds/thousands of robots. The community has leveraged model-free multi-agent reinforcement learning (MARL) to devise efficient, scalable controllers. This review aims to provide an analysis of the state-of-the-art in distributed MARL for multi-rob cooperation. The review is focused on the state of the art in distributed MarL for multiboot cooperation.
